TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesday: Slow News Day II

Articles.Content: **Marco (Samssonart)** > > This week I helped with some Steam community showcase of the gamers edition KSP bundle, if you havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t seen it yet check it out here: [https://www.gamersedition.com/]([https://www.gamersedition.com/](https://www.gamersedition.com/)product/kerbal-space-program">https://www.gamersedition.com/product/kerbal-space-program'>[https://www.gamersedition.com/](https://www.gamersedition.com/)product/kerbal-space-program > > Apart from that and the usual technical support IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been digging into Unity 5, and just this morning I started work with the surprise that Unity 5.1 is now a thing. This is fortunate I suppose, because weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not done porting from 4.6, but the things we havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t touched yet will not be needing double work, we can port them right into 5.1, that is of course assuming there were changes to that particular area from 5.0 to 5.1 . One area that we have already been working on and changed further in 5.1 are physics joints, so those will now require a bit more work, but it doesnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t look quite as bad. **Max (Maxmaps)** > > And again IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m in the position where I canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t really share what IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m working on businesswise except for the fact that itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s pretty cool and it wonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be too long til you learn some of it. Other than that, the GamerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Edition came out as well as the GoG summer sale! ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s always fun working with new partners, exposing yourself to their corporate culture and viceversa. 1.0.3 experimentals have been doing well, and thereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a big chance weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll see an extra bit thrown into it as a way to thank you all for your patience. **Ted (Ted)** > > ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been another rather slow week with the developers still enjoying some well deserved R&R. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been continuing with my production duties as well as assisting the Experimental Team with 1.0.3, putting in some smaller changes/fixes in the downtime as well as something rather brilliant from RoverDude - a smaller feature but one that should prove very useful for all. (IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll leave it to him to spill the kerosene on that one!) **Kasper (KasperVld)** > > I can imagine itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a calm week at the office with the development of the game taking a pause after months of frantic work. The franticness of the community never stops however, and IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m glad it didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t this week either. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been moving forward on the forum upgrade to IPS 4 since it was released, and though we donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t have anything definitive yet itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s looking like the IPS suite offers everything we need. > > IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m very happy to see KSP did really well during the GOG.com Summer Sale, reaching #3 in the best selling list. Because of this itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s now part of the highlights and you can get it at 25% off for a little while longer at [http://www.gog.com/game/kerbal_space_program]([http://www.gog.com/game/kerbal_space_program](http://www.gog.com/game/kerbal_space_program). > > This week weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve also seen the GamerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Edition offer go live ([https://www.gamersedition.com/]([https://www.gamersedition.com/](https://www.gamersedition.com/)) and of course the lovely people at Sketchfab made it possible to import .craft files ([ > "> > ](

Nice!

Looking forward to Unity 5 and all it's glory. (and new physics joints. no more wobbly rockets?) ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Cheers,

~Claw

> 
> something rather brilliant from RoverDude - a smaller feature but one that should prove very useful for all. (IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll leave it to him to spill the kerosene on that one!)

No dev notes from RoverDude?

I can't wait to see what that special addition to 1.0.3 is! \*cough\* magicboulderpls \*cough\*

Although it is *awfully* fun to complain about it... Lol

> 
> No dev notes from RoverDude?

RoverDude is a contractor, historically they do no participate in the devnotes... but the door has been opened so... RoverDude where are you? I want all the juicy stuffs.
Thanks for the update team! Good to hear about the thorough 1.0.3 experimentals. No rush, take your time to get it right!

Finally an OpenGL update, the 2.1 spec they've been locked to up to now is (graphically) ancient. I wonder what the HLSL update will offer for Mac/Linux users?

RoverDude, what is this Kerosene Ted speaks of?

> 
> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been continuing with my production duties as well as assisting the Experimental Team with 1.0.3, putting in some smaller changes/fixes in the downtime as well as something rather brilliant from RoverDude - a smaller feature but one that should prove very useful for all. (IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll leave it to him to spill the kerosene on that one!)

What can it be!?!?!?!?!?!?!?

Clamshell fairings, anyone?

Awesome, looking forward to seeing what 1.0.3 bring us! 

> 
> the lovely people at Sketchfab made it possible to import .craft files ([<iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/127469305" width="1280" height="720" frameborder="0" title="How to publish your Kerbal Space Program craft to Sketchfab" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>](<div%20class=)
> ">
> 
> <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/127469305" width="1280" height="720" frameborder="0" title="How to publish your Kerbal Space Program craft to Sketchfab" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> ) on their system, allowing you to share craft files in 3D! \*poke\* \*nudge\* Katateochi, perhaps KerbalX could use this?

I (very recently) added Sketchfab support to KerbalX! You can now display the 3D viewer in the same way as you can here with sketchfab tags;

[noparse] <iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

ie: <iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>[/noparse]

luizopiloto suggested this a couple of weeks ago, here's one of his craft with a sketchfab rendering [http://kerbalx.com/luizopiloto/Lear-98](http://kerbalx.com/luizopiloto/Lear-98)
The excitement and curiousity is intense! I cant wait to.. eh... get.. my hands..? on that kerosene!?

> 
> What can it be!?!?!?!?!?!?!?
> Clamshell fairings, anyone?

That's an aesthetic thing really, plus it doesn't really seem up RoverDude's (colonisation/resources) alley either?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T22:27:01Z" title="06/09/2015 10:27  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by NoMrBond**
  
e

RoverDude doesn't have to say a word, forum curiosity is adding plenty of fuel to the fire ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I would keep my expectations in check however: "an extra bit" or "small feature" is probably exactly that: not a game-changer, or massive overhaul.

ps, nice devnote title. I had a feeling we were being set up for this, last week ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-09T22:17:50Z" title="06/09/2015 10:17  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 9, 2015</time> by basic.syntax**
Awesome ! KSP + Unity5 = super awesomeness ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Seems some things convert more readily than others.

<iframe width="640" height="480" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>

This was pretty flawless though.

> RoverDude is a contractor, historically they do no participate in the devnotes... but the door has been opened so... RoverDude where are you? I want all the juicy stuffs.

> RoverDude, what is this Kerosene Ted speaks of?

> 
> What can it be!?!?!?!?!?!?!?
> Clamshell fairings, anyone?

heh, I thought my ears were burning.

It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.

Oh... and there was a hint in that previous statement. Let the speculation begin.
Stock part reflection?

> 
> heh, I thought my ears were burning.
> It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.
> 
> Oh... and there was a hint in that previous statement. Let the speculation begin.

Something to do with heat then?

> 
> heh, I thought my ears were burning.
> It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.
> 
> Oh... and there was a hint in that previous statement. Let the speculation begin.

Sound overhaul!!!! Maybe?

> 
> Something to do with heat then?

Yeah, sounds like a dedicated radiator part, which makes sense since the game is currently sorely lacking in one. Not exactly anything to get excited about, but sure beats the whole "use solar panels for cooling" thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> ... It's a small thing - but **super cool**, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 [....]

Am I "warm?"

> 
> heh, I thought my ears were burning.
> It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.
> 
> Oh... and there was a hint in that previous statement. Let the speculation begin.

If his "previous statement" is this: "heh, I thought my **ears** were **burning**." Then it's probably sound or heat related.

If it's "It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased."

That "green lighted" is interesting, as is "but I'm pretty pleased with where it **landed**".

This grammar mistake is a bit strange: "It's a small thing - but super cool, **and** thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3".

"but super cool" Also hints at a heat related feature.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Yeah, sounds like a dedicated radiator part, which makes sense since the game is currently sorely lacking in one. Not exactly anything to get excited about, but sure beats the whole "use solar panels for cooling" thing ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Ah, but this: "it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release" and this: "and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so." Hints that he/she's been working on it for a while.

He said it was in the previous statement, which means it can't be in that first sentence, it has to be in this part:

> 
> It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with where it landed, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.
> Unless RoverDude wasn't being strictly literal.
> 
> \*gasps\*
> 
> Moho heat? Maybe?

> 
> heh, I thought my ears were burning.
> It's a small thing - but super cool, and thrilled we were able to get it green lighted for 1.0.3 - it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release, but I'm pretty pleased with **where it landed**, and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so. I think folks will be pleased.
> 
> Oh... and there was a hint in that previous statement. Let the speculation begin.

It's landing site approximation

> 
> Ah, but this: "it's something I had been tinkering with in anticipation of a future release" and this: "and have been doing a ton of personal playtesting in my own save for the past month or so." Hints that he/she's been working on it for a while.

A very fancy looking radiator then? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

You could be right there, as art aside, a radiator is like a ten-minute config file job as far as I know. Also not certain if Squad would hype something that simple, as while I've come to temper my expectations a great deal when they start dropping hints, doing so about something that mundane seems a bit much.

I'm skeptical about it being something heat related. He'd been waiting up until a few days ago for Nertea's Heat Control plugin to get done as he stated he wanted it as a dependency for MKS. I bet its something to do with one of his existing mods.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> It's landing site approximation

now **this** would be very cool.
